definition: to take troubles to heart (idiom); brooding
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)

sentences.english: The nature of this income is what rankles.
sentences.chinese: 这些收入的性质正是让人耿耿于怀的地方。

sentences.english: Victory in the heart of LiuJianMin cast money for beautiful things from the book.
sentences.chinese: 胜利心中还对刘建民给美丽投钱出书的事耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: She hated Simpson, even though she handed her the crown.
sentences.chinese: 尽管辛普森让她头顶皇冠，她依然对前者耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: Don't get too detailed on this or go overboard with your preparations.
sentences.chinese: 清单不宜过细，对准备工作也别过于耿耿于怀了。

sentences.english: That anything to make you grudge or concerned isn't what I wonna see.
sentences.chinese: 这事让你耿耿于怀，或关心的并非是我想看到的。

sentences.english: Monroe complains too about her early adolescent experiences of sexual harassment.
sentences.chinese: 梦露对自己少女时期经历的性骚扰耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: Bostonians' reserved demeanor had bothered him for years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他一直对波士顿人腼腆的性格耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: The only thing that rankles me is what she says about Ireland .
sentences.chinese: 唯一使我耿耿于怀的就是她那些关于爱尔兰的言论。

sentences.english: The insult still rankled in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他对那次受辱仍耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: But he couldn't forget his brush with fame and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 但他仍对与荣誉和财富擦肩而过的往事耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: Some, resenting being sent, failed to fulfil their potential.
sentences.chinese: 有些人对被派到基层耿耿于怀，没能发挥他们的潜力。

sentences.english: Look for the one most emotionally gripped by his own failings.
sentences.chinese: 寻找一位情感上对自己的缺点最耿耿于怀的总统。

sentences.english: I'm still screwed-up about the accident.
sentences.chinese: 我仍对那次的事故耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: The King, came back, and he was depressed after the false pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 国王归来了，他一直对这错误的追捕耿耿于怀。

definition: to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
